text: Melanocetus murrayi, also called the Murray's abyssal anglerfish, is an anglerfish in the family Melanocetidae. It can live 2000 m (6,600 ft) deep. == Description == Females can reach 13.5 cm (5 in). For males, however, they're shorter, only reaching 2.8 cm (1.1 in) long. Just like all anglerfish, the females have a bioluminescent organ called an esca. == Related pages == * Humpback anglerfish == References == # Arnold, R. (2015). "Melanocetus murrayi". IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Category:IUCN Red List least concern species Category:Ray-finned fish Category:Bioluminescent animals
title: Melanocetus murrayi
